stu_tags: PARTICIPATION MATTERS  LOTS OF HOMEWORK  EXTRA CREDIT
comments: Professor Eret is a great teacher! He is nice but demands the basic needs from his students. He does give a lot of work but more so watching videos, reading articles, going into your community for assignments or extra credit but the actual writing part is easy. HE HATES PLAGIARISM, do not even do it. His online class was fun and interesting.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: Not an extremely exciting class. Jumps around a lot as far as subject material. Doesn\'t assign too much homework, tests are MC. I wouldn\'t take him again, as he never really "clicked" with me as a teacher.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: This class is actually very interesting as we studied a lot of subjects about society and humanities. Eret constantly engages the class by asking questions, showing videos, creating games, and giving a chance for students to discuss their opinions about the subject. Great class, there are 2 projects a few tests, and a final.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: Dr. Eret is a top-tier teacher that I feel is in the ranks of a Cal professor. He sincerely enjoys the material and it shows through his lectures. Standard PPT lecture that is available online; Dr. Eret is easily accessible for clarifying questions and very flexible with deadlines and personal issues. Take his class - you won\'t regret it!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: Eret is clever and kind. I think many students take advantage of his kindness, but if you really talk to him, you can learn. We\'re lucky at CoA to have a professor as intelligent and well-versed as him. I wish I had gotten to know him better! If you work in his class, you will learn some really amazing stuff!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: I had taken him awhile ago and it was a wonderful experience but this semester I have to say he has changed. He seemed to have a big chip on his solder.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: Best Humanities teacher ever!!!! There is no book, everything is on line, and open notes for the tests. The project is fun as hell.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: This was one of the best classes I have ever taken. Prof. Eret is really passionate about the subject matter and keeps the class engaged, lots of group work (not my fave) but totally worth it! Tests are not that hard if you keep careful notes, and the material is fun, no chore to read. TAKE THIS CLASS!!!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: Take his class. Sure it can get a little boring if you don\'t care to explore the topics he brings up in class. That\'s your own fault if you\'re bored. I found the class interesting and engaging. Dr. Eret is a great professor, a kind person and very helpful. He wants you to succeed!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: super easy & super boring. Just do the blogs and projects and youll get an A. open notes on tests and final. No text book. Enough said. there is no reason you wont get an A unless you simply dont do the work

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: i like the way he teaches! I tried very hard to earn an A. The best part in his assesment was a weekly blog , and believe it or not it helped me to get an A !!! dont be lazy do the blog!

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: Best teacher ever The class is fun and interesting! two big projects(1500+ words each). blog every week! he is easy on grades! i passed with A+

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: i love Eret! take he is class! you will learn a lot plus he will gave you an effort if you try ! highly highly recomend his class ! i will take another class !

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: First, he\'s a good and mostly interesting teacher; I highly recommend him. He also does not use a textbook--bonus! That said, his myth class should be renamed "Oral Storytelling"--don\'t expect to do an in depth study of myths (gods, dragons, etc). Also, don\'t attend if you have a sensitivity to tragedy stories, as he seems strangely drawn to them.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: The best professor I\'ve had so far in COA. He makes the subjects super interesting and class not boring. He uses power point slides and with videos and other activities to keep the class not boring. He is very knowledgeable of the subject. I would for sure recommend his class.

tag_professor: Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  Respected (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: Nice teacher and his class was very interesting. No textbook because he posts blogs to read which can be very lengthy but just do them. Tests are open notes and 2 projects which are somewhat related to the class. I may take another class from him
